column2: DLMCD1966, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have always had a touch of sciatica in lower back and left leg but recently my doctor decided I had symptoms of multiple sclerosis which I am not sure about yet.  3 days after the lumbar puncture I was in the worst pain of my life.  I tried handfuls of ibuprofen and it did not work, tried several anti inflamitory meds and they did not help much.  The doctor put me on this medication and hydrocodone.  This medication helped far more than the hydrocodone alone.  It still hurt a lot after just a hydrocodone and then I tried this patch and suddenly for the first time in weeks was not in unbearable pain.  I have found I can skip the hydrocodone and just use this patch and it works for 12 hours and a few hours after it is removed.  If you have lower back pain I cannot say enough about this patch.  You must try it.  I just woke up in pain an hour ago and could not even sit on toilet and put on one of these patches and now the pain is totally gone.  I would choose this patch every time before a narcotic.  I don't even know I have a back and left leg now.  Excellent.

column2: 4freedom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: These 5% lidocaine patches work well for me. They help with DDD and nerve pain in my neck..I am now using them for my fibromyalgia pains. That is deep muscle pain of stinging and swelling of my neck and shoulders and knees and sometimes elbows..I use them at night along with my other pain medications..They help with the pain and swelling so I can sleep better during the night. I have Costochondritis, and it's causing swelling and some choking at times. Right now I'm getting some relief using this patch..only problem so far is they tend to come loose from movement. They are also expensive, but worth it at this point..I read some others say that these have caused cancer in rats,tumors, and heart problems..I hope not, because they work well for me while they are on, but pain comes back...so it is also a temporary fix, but it helps !!

Until there's a way to regenerate cartilage, this is the best, non-addictive solution for me.

column2: Cbear429, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this patch and it works very well B4 my drug plan stopped paying for it. For my back injury and muscle spasms, I also used it for osteoarthritis pain of my right hip while walking. I had shoulder pain due to exercise and I used it there as well. It worked. Now I have to come up with $1400 for a 90 day supply. The FDA should approve this patch for use of pain due to spinal injury pain, herniated discs and muscle spasms of any condition and arthritis joint pain. Like another post, It does not cancel out all of the pain but it kept me going. Now I have to find a way to pay for it. Maybe medicare's drug plan. How does a drug plan decision override my doctors prescription who knows whats best for their patients?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use lidoderm to treat pain in my neck and also skin pain on my back near my shoulder. the pain is gone within minutes.

column2: themorrispine, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: The first pain mgmt doctor I went to prescribed Lidoderm patches for me. He went into detail exactly how to apply these for the best relief.  I have been using them regularly for approx 8 years now.  I would gladly give up the pa8in medications that could lead to addiction and other problems to use these pads.  Since the FDA only approved the patches for relief of post herpetic neuralgia, I can no longer get the patches, but am in the process of trying to go thru Endo to get these.  These have always been a tremendous help to me in controlling my pain. They help 100% better than the pain medications that I am now forced to take until I can find a way to get these patches again.l

column9: I have been prescribed Lidoderm 5% by Endo. I am a past polio patient, cervial surgery to repair c4,c5,c6,c7, and plate, a stroke and last winter I fell after an accident under my suv in a backward fall 45 % angle which severely bruised my lower back and resulted in medical retirement and bedrest that has lasted 6 months and no improvement. This patch along with other medications has been a miracle for me. Recently possible dignose of post polio fibromalgia? I just know the patch is a part of my life.

column2: Harv1948, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 60 year old male with painful diabetic neuropathy in my toes. Previously, I have tried EVERYTHING ... gabapentin, lyrica, vicodene, hot pepper based ointments,etc. THIS LIDODERM PATCH WORKS! In fact, I placed the patch on my foot where the nerves lead to toes and wore a sock over it to keep it covered at night. I SLEPT for the 1ST time in 4 YEARS nearly all night!!!! WARNING THOUGH - THIS STUFF MAKES YOU SICK TOO!!! I ALMOST HAD A HEART ATTACK!!! CAN CAUSE SUDDEN ARYTHMIA -MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION!! TYPE IN SIDE EFFECTS ON GOOGLE!!!!! USE WITH CAUTION!!!!
